{"step_by_step_thinking": "Foscarnet is an antiviral medication used to treat certain viral infections. It works by inhibiting viral DNA polymerase. Adverse effects of Foscarnet can include electrolyte imbalances. Hypercalcemia is not an adverse effect of Foscarnet. Hyperkalemia, hypocalcemia, and hypokalemia are all possible adverse effects. Therefore, the correct answer is A. Hypercalcemia.", "answer_choice": "A"}
